Package de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking

Contains all server specific code, such as the client connections and their manager.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ClientLossListener
    This interface is used to signal the AbstractPsychicServer of the loss of a client, so it can decide on further server advertisement.
    NetworkDataSink
    This interface is used when you want to define a data splitter, or an end piece of the data pipeline that consumes the incoming data.
    NetworkDataSource
    Interface for sensor data sources on the server side.
    UnexpectedClientListener
    Register for events where two clients try to use the same slot.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractPsychicServer
    This class encapsulates the whole server system:
    ClientConnection
    This class manages the command- and data connection for a single client.
    ClientConnectionManager
    The client connection manager handles the expected client state (sensor speeds, button config etc), as well as the ClientConnection instances used to allow communication with the clients.
    DataConnection
    This class listens for udp packets containing SensorData objects, and notifies a listener of new data.
    DataMapper
    This class is designed to forward data to NetworkDataSinks.
    DiscoveryServer
    Use this class to wait for incoming discovery requests
    PsychicServer
    This subclass of AbstractPsychicServer can be used if you only want to know about specific callbacks, or cannot subclass AbstractPsychicServer.

Package de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking Description

Contains all server specific code, such as the client connections and their manager. Most notable, however, are the PsychicServer and the AbstractPsychicServer classes, because if you want to utilise the framework, you have to either subclass AbstractPsychicServer, or instantiate a PsychicServer.
